deity.name: Angrosh, The Hammer Lord
deity.symbol: A hammer striking an anvil

customProperties.Worshippers: Dwarves, Rock Gnomes, Strongheart Halflings, craftsmen

entries: Tennets: To live is to improve oneself. You enter the world unworked, unshapen. Greet every day as an opportunity to craft your being into a shape befitting its purpose.
As a blacksmith hammers the impurities out from metal, so must you seek to remove the impurities from yourself that keep you from serving your people.
Always seek perfection in your given tasks and create things that last so they may benefit Angrosh's chosen people long past your mortal life.

deity.name: Gargan, The Great Serpent
deity.symbol: Three snake coils emerging from the waves
entries: Tennets: To live is to exist by the grace of Gargan. Bow to the Lord of Waves and bring offerings, that his gaze may pass you over when you travel his waters.
Be grateful for the bounty of the sea and for good winds.
The Serpent's wrath is swift and terrible for those who do not fear and venerate him as they should, but he is also merciful towards the pious.
If you seek relief from burdens of the mind and soul, offer them up to Gargan, that his waves may carry them away.

deity.name: Gren, The Clever Trickster
deity.symbol: A fox head in front of a gold coin

customProperties.Worshippers: Halflings, Hill Dwarves, and Gnomes, traders, thieves

entries: Tennets: To live is to strive for success. Coin and riches shall be the hallmarks of yours.

Appreciate and sharpen the tools of your trade, your head most of all. Always seek the {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}, even when you do not need to. Look for opportunities and seize them where you can.
The Trickster respects an agile mind. Be cunning and devious, but never violent unless forced.

deity.name: Graffir, The Wolf of Winter
deity.symbol: A white wolf howling against the night sky
entries: Tennets: To live is to eat or be eaten. If you wish to be a hunter, you must be strong, you must be swift, your cunning greater than that of your prey.
If you cannot embody these ideals of the Great Wolf, then you will serve as meat for those stronger than you instead.
A hunter does not kill without cause, however. Do not misuse your strength to kill unless to feed or defend yourself.
If you find someone that reaps the Wild's Bounty without due cause, be the iron jaws that close around their throat.

deity.name: Krumr, The Storm's Fury
deity.symbol: A black, red-rimmed fist clenching a lightning bolt

customProperties.Portfolio: Warriors, Strength, Struggle, Storms, Autumn, Air

entries: Tennets: To live is to fight. Every day is a test to temper your resolve. Every challenge another stepping stone to become greater than you are.
Battle is the sacred crucible in which true warriors are forged. Seek out battle, but fight openly and without trickery. Deceit is for the weak.
To be strong is to prove yourself worthy of living. Do not aid the weak, for you will but enable them to grow more feeble.

deity.name: Lanathiil, The Green Lord
deity.symbol: An upwards-pointing leaf with a male elven face on it

customProperties.Portfolio: Wood and High Elves, Nature, The Arts, Spring, Earth
customProperties.Worshippers: High and Wood Elves, some Forest Gnomes, rangers, wilderness-dwellers

entries: Tennets: To live is to hear the Green Lord's song. He is greatest among the Divine, and the Elves are his chosen people.
Exemplify the grace and beauty that he has bestowed upon your blood. Spread the enchanting melodies that he has devised for your ears, and see that the world around you is made pleasing to his eyes.
Lanathiil is a guardian of nature, do not harm his creations, and punish those that dare besmirch his sacred sites.

deity.name: Perinae, The Lifegiver
deity.symbol: A wheat stalk in front of a green field
entries: Tennets: To live is to foster life. Guard and nourish life where you go. Help new life spring into being and fight poison and disease to protect existing life.
To help those ailing is your sacred duty. Do not bring harm upon those entrusted into your care.
Conflict is the enemy of living things. You are a preserver of life. Do not raise your hand against a living being unless as a last resort to protect another one.

deity.name: Naushindhor, The Guarding of Secret Knowledge
deity.symbol: A red dragon resting its front legs on a golden key
entries: Tennets: To live is to learn. Walk through the world with eyes that ask questions. See behind the curtain of existence and try to gain understanding.
Share knowledge that you have gained responsibly to benefit others. Likewise, be ever the student to learn from others as well.
If you have acquired knowledge that is too dangerous, see that it is locked away to be never obtained again. To learn is to be blessed, but in some cases ignorance can be the greater blessing.

deity.name: Rahya, The Radiant Sun
deity.symbol: A golden red-rimmed sun with a venus sign in its center
entries: Tennets: To live is to love. There is no greater fulfillment than to join your heart to another. There are many kinds of love, and you are to guide and foster all of them.
Love yourself as well, be beautiful of both body and character, and teach others to do the same. Create beauty and joy where you go, for only a joyful heart can truly love.
Love is a bringer of harmony. Mend the rifts between lovers, bring peace to simmering conflicts, and teach kindness where you go. War is the enemy of love, but ever does the latter win.

deity.name: Setifor, The Oathkeeper
deity.symbol: A sword lain over a pair of scales
entries: Tennets: To live is to serve. You are the shield that guards the innocent and the sword that slays the wicked. You are the vigilant watcher and the bulwark against chaos.

Order is the lifeblood of civilization, and you are its guardian. Never betray this sacred trust, be truthful always in word and deed. Serve loyally and ably, hone your swordarm so that you do not falter in the face of evil.
Duty is a harsh mistress. Be ready and willing to sacrifice, for you may be called to do so in service of the greater whole.

deity.name: The Pale Knight
deity.symbol: A hooded figure holding an hourglass

customProperties.Worshippers: Shadowborn, few mortals, but countless pay tribute in hopes of not meeting an "untimely" end, especially before starting a journey

entries: Tennets: To live is to travel a road. The master of this road demands a toll, but he is a generous lord and content to wait, so that everyone may travel his road. But always does he collect in the end.
Existence consists of cycles hinging on a fragile balance. Fate is the arbiter of this balance. Everything must follow its predetermined cause, everyone must travel the road to its end.

Our lord is merciful, in his embrace all suffering does end. But he reserves a harsh punishment for those who defy the cycle. Bring his judgement onto those that dare defy the natural order of things and seek to avoid paying him what he is due.

deity.name: Vaeraustraee, The Veiled Lady
deity.symbol: A sword pointing upwards in front of a full moon

customProperties.Portfolio: Dark Elves, Passion, Swordplay, Dance, Motherhood, The Moon

entries: Tennets: To live is to rejoice in the favor of our lady, her guidance and her protection. She loves us as her children, and so we in turn shall love her as our mother.
As a woman, be the gentle hand that raises and guides. Lead wisely and responsibly and see that your people flourishes.
As a man, be the clenched fist that is raised high to strike down our foes. Be ever-watchful and merciless towards those that would threaten your people.
Give thanks with both the velvet and the iron dance. Cherish and protect children. Let your heart soar with joy at the home that she has carved for us.

deity.name: The Scarlet Emperor
entries: The only mortal on this list, and even said mortality has often been called into question. For good reason, for if historical accounts can be believed, he has been around for almost 300 years.

Though they are loath to admit it, even the mages of Dask Diirthir and Amaned'Anar know him to be the most powerful magic user on Ishiir by far. His opening of an army-sized portal during the Battle of Rakhan Field remains a magical feat of a scale that thus far no one has been able to truly understand, let alone replicate.

Though he had been very active on the political stage during the later years of the Great War and its immediate aftermath, the Emperor has since withdrawn his presence from public eye and rules from within the Ruby Citadel.
Those who met him during their lifetime have described him as an attractive Nessian male of supreme diplomatic ability and a wit to match.

deity.name: The King of Frost
entries: A cold and cruel entity that rules over the Unseelie Court, a particularly capricious and easily provoked breed of fey.

The King of Frost rules over his domain of Everwinter from the Castle of Frozen Tears, a towering spire formed from magic ice that was supposedly created when his heart froze in his chest after his lover betrayed him.

deity.name: The Queen of Summer
entries: The queen of the mercurial Summer Court is said to be so beautiful that she rivals Rahya herself. She rules her realm of Neverwilt from the Wandering Palace, an impressive construction of shining ivory that changes its location each day.
She doesn't take interest in events on the Material Plane so much as individuals.
Often, these end up whisked away by her servants to be brought to her court to entertain her. Their stay will be an enjoyable one, so long as they do.

deity.name: The Hag Queen
entries: Bearing a heart far darker than those of even the most cruel Unseelie, the Hag Queen was banished from the Feywild by the joint might of several other powerful fey, including both the King of Frost and Queen of Summer.
This did little curb her ambitions, however, and her machinations have brought much suffering on the Material Plane, most of all the Haghome peninsula and the humans that inhabit it.

The Hag Queen hates all fey except her own hags and their servants with a passion and schemes restlessly to eventually reclaim what she considers her rightful place in the twilit realms of the Feywild.

deity.name: The Horned Baron
entries: The lord of pans, satyrs, and several other horned kind of fey is said to be hedonistic to a fault - with a particular weakness for beautiful mortals, both male and female, as well as fine music and drink.

Though technically a member of the Seelie Court, The Horned Baron does not take his obligations very seriously, if at all, and is often found wandering the forests or lounging in clearings surrounded by awestruck attendants.
As a result, his relationship with the Queen of Summer is rather poor, though it hasn't yet escalated into open conflict.

deity.name: The Princess of the Forest
entries: The favored daughter of the Queen of Summer is a free spirit that can often be found away from her mother's wandering court.
Benevolent and kind, she has often saved wayward mortals from the more dangerous aspects of the Feywild and has even been seen entering the Material to satisfy her great curiousity at times.
Her inherited fierce streak only shows when she is witness to animal or plant life being harmed.

deity.name: The Queen of Waves
entries: The mysterious Queen of Waves rules over all naiads, water nymphs, and other waterbound fey.
With the exception of the banished Hag Queen, she is the fey ruler that is most often found on the Material Plane, residing in one of her several coral castles at the bottom of the Freyrgerang.
Also of note is her close relationship to Gargan, as a result of which the Freyrgerang is always spared his wrath.

deity.name: Old Uncle Oak
entries: Rumored to be the oldest creature in the Feywild, this ancient sentient tree possesses great powers of divination and is sought out by immortals and mortals alike for his prophecies.

items.name: Element:
entries: Lightning

items.name: Personality:
entries: Taciturn and serious, the arbiters and functionaries of dragon kind.

items.name: Patronees:
entries: Likes patronees that... have dutiful and principled conduct.

items.name: Element:
entries: Force

items.name: Personality:
entries: Sagacious and epistemophilic, the eternal students and Naushindhor's closest followers.

items.name: Patronees:
entries: Likes patronees that... are erudite and can be engaged in conversations about scholarly matters.

items.name: Element:
entries: Radiant

items.name: Personality:
entries: Valorous and kind, draconic champions of good and justice.

items.name: Patronees:
entries: Likes patronees that... dedicate themselves to fight evil and defend others.

items.name: Element:
entries: Necrotic

items.name: Personality:
entries: Sinister and callous, dragons that dwell in the Shadowfell and have been shaped by it.

items.name: Patronees:
entries: Likes patronees that... are hardened individuals who do not concern themselves with moral qualms.

items.name: Element:
entries: Poison

items.name: Personality:
entries: Cunning schemers, who manipulate events and individuals from the shadows.

items.name: Patronees:
entries: Likes patronees that... are well-spoken and discreet.

items.name: Element:
entries: Lightning

items.name: Personality:
entries: Bold and adventurous, wandering draconic warriors who fight injustice where they find it.

items.name: Patronees:
entries: Likes patronees that... are foolhardy and outspoken.

items.name: Element:
entries: Poison

items.name: Personality:
entries: Gentle and nurturing, caretakers and guardians of nature.

items.name: Patronees:
entries: Likes patronees that... protect and are kind to animals and plants.

items.name: Element:
entries: Radiant

items.name: Personality:
entries: Stern and regal, the lawmakers and leaders of dragon kind.

items.name: Patronees:
entries: Likes patronees that... see the bigger picture and seek to serve the greater whole.

items.name: Element:
entries: Acid

items.name: Personality:
entries: Jovial and mischievous, the pranksters and artists amongst dragons.

items.name: Patronees:
entries: Likes patronees that... have a good sense of humor and artistic inclinations.

items.name: Element:
entries: Cold

items.name: Personality:
entries: Stoic and pragmatic, dragon warriors who seek out hostile environs and dangerous prey to test themselves.

items.name: Patronees:
entries: Likes patronees that... speak little and have proven themselves against adversity.

items.name: Element:
entries: Fire

items.name: Personality:
entries: Belligerent and maniacal, they seemingly live only to spread disorder and ruin.

items.name: Patronees:
entries: Likes patronees that... are more than a little kooky and follow their impulses.

items.name: Element:
entries: Fire

items.name: Personality:
entries: Eloquent and insightful, the emissaries and diplomats among dragon kind.

items.name: Patronees:
entries: Likes patronees that... prefer to solve conflicts through words rather than violence.

items.name: Element:
entries: Fire

items.name: Personality:
entries: Proud and quick-tempered, these ardent warrior mages view themselves as the apex of draconic glory.

items.name: Patronees:
entries: Likes patronees that... are ambitious and successful (so they can brag about them).

items.name: Element:
entries: Cold

items.name: Personality:
entries: Ruthless and enterprising, they are greedy even by dragon standards.

items.name: Patronees:
entries: Likes patronees that... know which side of their bread is buttered.

items.name: Element:
entries: Acid

items.name: Personality:
entries: Cruel and sadistic, they revel in the suffering of other creatures.

items.name: Patronees:
entries: Likes patronees that... serve them unwillingly and whose deeds in service of the dragon weigh on them.

deity.name: Xavarash, The Destroyer
deity.symbol: A toppled, broken pillar before a black flame.

deity.name: Charyptoroth, The Maw of the Deep
deity.symbol: A maelstrom with a black center.

deity.name: Azzagrazzt, The Dark Prince Of Deceit
deity.symbol: A silhouette of a smiling male head with nine horns.

deity.name: Athar'hagaz, The Hunter Of Gods
deity.symbol: A grinning bestial skull, covered in rime and icicles.

deity.name: Golgathor, The Blood Drinker
deity.symbol: A waterfall of black blood flowing from a skull.

deity.name: G'zarogg, The Eternal Hunger
deity.symbol: Three concentric circles with teeth lining their inner sides.

deity.name: Belhifesh, The Plaguebringer
deity.symbol: A chalice made from bones with a droplet-shaped gem.

deity.name: Tasfashir, The Bearer Of Forbidden Knowledge
deity.symbol: An open book with a lidless eye in its center.

deity.name: Vaasaleth, The Queen Of Desire
deity.symbol: A female body caressing itself, covered in blood and jagged chains.

deity.name: Aathoth, The Oathbreaker
deity.symbol: A sword whose crossguard forms a pair of scales, whose left side is weighed down by a black feather.

deity.name: Xarsateth, The Queen Of Bones
deity.symbol: A skull adorned with a black crown.

deity.name: Araushneth, The Queen Of Dark
deity.symbol: A pitch-black circle.

deity.name: Other Demons
entries: Each Archdemon is served by myriads upon myriads of lesser demons of varying power. These demons correspond to their Archdemon masters in demeanor and general nature.

Due to the heavy stigma associated with it, the access to knowledge of demonology is very limited. What is known, however, is that there is a hierarchy related to the number of 'horns' these demons possess, going from the weakest at one to the highest Non-Archdemons at eight.
These horns are assumed to be part of the creatures' astral bodies and do not necessarily manifest when they materialize on a different plane.
